1.text: Why, Job, I pray you, hear my speeches, and listen to all my words.

2.text: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue has spoken in my mouth.

3.text: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

4.text: The spirit of God has made me, and the breath of the Almighty has given me life.

5.text: If you can answer me, set your words in order before me, stand up.

6.text: Behold, I am according to your wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

7.text: Behold, my terror shall not make you afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy on you.

8.text: Surely you have spoken in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of your words, saying,

9.text: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

10.text: Behold, he finds occasions against me, he counts me for his enemy,

11.text: He puts my feet in the stocks, he marks all my paths.

12.text: Behold, in this you are not just: I will answer you, that God is greater than man.

13.text: Why do you strive against him? for he gives not account of any of his matters.

14.text: For God speaks once, yes twice, yet man perceives it not.

15.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falls on men, in slumberings on the bed;

16.text: Then he opens the ears of men, and seals their instruction,

17.text: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

18.text: He keeps back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

19.text: He is chastened also with pain on his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

20.text: So that his life abhors bread, and his soul dainty meat.

21.text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

22.text: Yes, his soul draws near to the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

23.text: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to show to man his uprightness:

24.text: Then he is gracious to him, and said, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

25.text: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:

26.text: He shall pray to God, and he will be favorable to him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render to man his righteousness.

27.text: He looks on men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

28.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

29.text: See, all these things works God oftentimes with man,

30.text: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

31.text: Mark well, O Job, listen to me: hold your peace, and I will speak.

32.text: If you have anything to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify you.

33.text: If not, listen to me: hold your peace, and I shall teach you wisdom.
